objinfo.printdate: 1795The characteristics of the color printing indicate that this impression is the second one printed in 1795. The coloring on the printing matrix was restored before this impression was printed. The first impression in the 1795 printing session is Satan Exulting Over Eve in the Tate Collection (Butlin 291).
objinfo.medium: planographic color printing with water color and pen and ink additions to the impression

provenance.name: J. Paul Getty Museum
provenance.note: Perhaps acquired by Blake's wife, Catherine, upon his death in 1827; perhaps acquired by Frederick Tatham upon Mrs. Blake's death in 1831; the dealer Joseph Hogarth, who offered the print, with the assistance of George Richmond, to John Ruskin c. 1843; at least briefly in Ruskin's possession, but probably returned to Hogarth; possibly the work sold Southgate and Barrett's auction, 13 June 1854, lot 1922 (£18s. to the dealer H. Palser); sold Sotheby's, 5 June 1896, lot 273 (£31 to the dealer Frank T. Sabin); William Bateson by 1906; by inheritance to his widow by 1927; by inheritance to their son, Geoffrey Bateson; sold from Geoffrey Bateson's estate in 1983 to the London dealer John Morton Morris; sold by Morris early in 1984 to the J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California ($325,000).

objnote.p: "Satan Exulting over Eve" takes its subject from the story of the fall in Genesis 3:1-6, but the design was also influenced by Eve's dream of Satan and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil in John Milton's "Paradise Lost," Book 5. Neither source, however, offers a precedent for Blake's double representation of Satan. His still human and angelic form, armed with shield and spear, hovers over the sleeping Eve, but his bat-like wings indicate his fallen condition. His serpentine form coils around Eve's lower body, arches over her head, and rests its crested head on her chest. Her right hand lies limply over the forbidden fruit.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Satan, nude, muscular and bat-winged, hovers over the supine form of Eve. He raises his arms horizontally (relative to the ground below) with his lower body horizontal, his upper body twisted upward, and his legs extended to the right. With his right hand he clasps a shield that is fastened with a strap to his elbow. In his left hand he holds an arrow-tipped spear. A serpent twines around Eve’s bare feet, coils around her legs and lower body, arches over her limp, backward-bent head, and rests its spiky, crested head on her breast. Eve has long, curly hair and lies with her legs together and her right arm at her side. Her right hand rests limply, fingers slightly spread, on the forbidden fruit. Eve lies on grass, moss, lichens, or some such vegetation. Her eyes are closed; she may be sleeping or in a trance. Flames mount upward from right to left from behind Eve's body and rise above Satan’s head. The sky upper right is dark.

component.illusobjdesc: Satan, nude, muscular and bat-winged, hovers over the supine form of Eve. He raises his arms horizontally (relative to the ground below) with his lower body horizontal, his upper body twisted upward, and his legs extended to the right. With his right hand, he clasps a shield fastened to his elbow with a strap. In his left hand he holds an arrow-tipped spear. Satan’s hair is short and curly, and his mouth may be slightly open. Although his lower body faces left, Satan’s head and upper body are twisted forward and face the viewer. Satan’s eyes look out toward the viewer and slightly up.

component.characteristic: Satan clasps a shield in his right hand that is fastened to his elbow with a strap (or short belt).

component.illusobjdesc: Satan holds an arrow-tipped spear in his left hand that he points downward and to the right.
Satan's serpent-form twines around Eve's lower body, wraps around her bare feet, arches over her limp, backward-bent head, and rests its crested head on her breast. The serpent's skin is scaly.

Supine, limp, and serpent-coiled, Eve lies below exultant Satan. She has long, curly hair, and lies with her legs together and her right arm at her side. Her right hand rests, fingers limply spread, on the forbidden fruit. Her bare feet are prominent, with one of the serpent's coils arching over and framing them. Her mouth is slightly open and her eyes are closed. She may be sleeping or in a trance.
Eve's limp hand rests on the forbidden fruit, which resembles an apple with a leaf or two on its stem.
Flames mount upward from right to left from behind Eve's body and rise above Satan's head. The sky at upper right is dark, perhaps with smoke or clouds (possibly at night).
Eve lies on grass, moss, lichens, or some such vegetation.
